Questions.Question: Who said, 'The two most powerful warriors are patience and time'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote was attributed to Leo Tolstoy, the renowned Russian author of 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina.'

Questions.Question: Which famous physicist said, 'Time is an illusion'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is often attributed to Albert Einstein, the revolutionary physicist and developer of the theory of relativity.

Questions.Question: Who stated, 'Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time' is like saying, 'I don't want to'?'
Questions.Explanation: This thought-provoking quote is commonly attributed to Lao Tzu, the ancient Chinese philosopher and founder of Taoism.

Questions.Question: Which philosopher said, 'Time is a game played beautifully by children'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is often credited to Heraclitus, the pre-Socratic Greek philosopher known for his contemplation of change and the nature of the universe.

Questions.Question: Who authored the phrase, 'The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it'?
Questions.Explanation: This insightful quote is attributed to Arnold H. Glasow, a well-known American businessman, and humorist.

Questions.Question: Which renowned writer said, 'The two most powerful warriors are patience and time'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is often attributed to Leo Tolstoy, the prolific Russian author and master of realist fiction.

Questions.Question: Who proclaimed, 'Time is the wisest counselor of all'?
Questions.Explanation: This insightful statement is attributed to Pericles, the influential statesman and orator of ancient Athens.

Questions.Question: Who is credited with saying, 'Time is what we want most, but what we use worst'?
Questions.Explanation: This profound quote is attributed to William Penn, the English Quaker leader and founder of the Province of Pennsylvania.

Questions.Question: Which Greek philosopher stated, 'Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is often misattributed to Thomas Edison, but its actual source is unknown. It is a play on similar themes from various ancient philosophies and modern motivational sources.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend'?
Questions.Explanation: This thought-provoking quote is attributed to Theophrastus, the ancient Greek philosopher and successor of Aristotle at the Peripatetic School.
